resources.string: A panoramic picture of Cluj Napoca

Cluj Napoca, as capital of historical region Transylvania, is one of the most visited cities in Romania. The city, with 324,576 people, is very pleasant, and it is certainly a great experience for those who want to see urban Transylvanian life at its best. Along with fine dining, excellent cultural activities, a wonderful historical legacy and a great atmosphere, the city will certainly not disappoint those who add it to their travel itinerary.
Use this app to find out what the best places in Cluj Napoca are. You will find information about the best restaurants, museums, parks, shopping centers and historical places.
Choose where you want to go.
A photo of the current location that the tourist can visit.
Beautifully laid out museum of Romanian folk culture which includes wooden agricultural and home tools from across Transylvania.
A small, but exceedingly interesting museum in the centre of the city. It has the original pharmacy furniture and equipment including the original laboratory in the cellar.

A museum housed in an important eighteenth-century Baroque building, the Cluj-Napoca Bánffy Palace. It possesses a very valuable collection of Romanian and European art: paintings, graphics and decorative art ranging from the Fifteenth Century to the Twentieth.
The Zoological Museum consists of several scientific animal collections, currently containing over 300,000 exhibition pieces.
The National Museum of Transylvanian History
A history and archaeology museum in the city of Cluj-Napoca, Romania. It features a permanent exhibition, as well as temporary exhibitions.
VIVO! Cluj-Napoca is the largest Romanian multifunctional complex built on a single level. It combines a full range of products and services in a modern urban setting.
Str. Avram Iancu, No 492–500, Cluj-Napoca 407280, Romania
Iulius Mall is a multi-level shopping mall with both multinational brands and local stores. It has a extensive food court with fast food from several cuisines.
Strada Vaida Voevod Alexandru no. 53 B, Cluj-Napoca 400436, Romania
Located in the center of the city, “the place in the heart of Cluj” has become the main reference while shopping in Cluj. It is addressing to the entire family, currently having 90 different stores
A central, chic shopping gallery with luxurious finishes and a perfect mix of services.
Calea Manastur 2–6, Calea Mănăștur, Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Central Park is a large, public urban park in central Cluj Napoca. It has a beautiful lake with ducks and swans and it is just a couple of minutes walk from the main stadium and concert hall.
Strada Cardinal Hossu Iuliu, Cluj-Napoca 400029, Romania
Cluj’s Botanical Garden is where the hustle and noise of the city remain outside the wall of vegetation.
The Fortress offers a nice view on the city. On sunny days, it can be a great spot for a picnic or stroll.
Fascinating outdoor museum. It has gathered together a variety of old buildings from around Transylvania and re-installed them in a park like setting.

Big Belly is a restaurant that meets all tastes with quality food suitable for everyone and in any context. You can order to eat at home or office chosing from pizza to salads, from shaorma with grilled crispy chicken on plate or pita, chicken legs and wings, kebab and prosciutto sandwiches and many other dishes

Argentinian restaurant El Toro Steakhouse is the first authentic steakhouse in Cluj-Napoca. The central piece is the Argentinean steak in the usual cuts, grilled on a wood and charcoal barbeque, visibly placed in the middle of the restaurant.
Hanul Dacilor Restaurant is known for its delicious traditional Romanian food. Traditional atmosphere, nicely decorated with wood furniture, wool, stone and old peasant tools.
Indigo is an Indian restaurant located in the heart of Transylvania. Indian cuisine is as much about hot and spicy food as are its aromatic dishes which are completely non-spicy.
The purpose of this restaurant is to create, produce and serve super great, full-flavored food that has a beginning, middle, and finish to every bite accompanied by live music.
The best Japanese restaurant in Romania! It stands for tradition, quality and respect for every client.

Bánffy Castle is a baroque building of the 18th century in Cluj-Napoca, designed by the German architect Johann Eberhard Blaumann. Built between 1774 and 1775 it is considered the most representative for the baroque style of Transylvania.

The Matthias Corvinus House is one of the oldest buildings in Cluj-Napoca, Transylvania, Romania. It was built in the 15th century, in the gothic style, as a small guesthouse. During its history, the house served as a jail, hospital, and museum; it is now home to a visual arts institute.
Museum Square is a charming, rustic, history-filled part of Cluj and is even more worth a visit since it is a cobble stoned pedestrian area.
The Cluj-Napoca Tailors\' Tower is located at the southeast corner of the old Cluj-Napoca citadel. It was built in the 15th century and rebuilt between 1627 and 1629, assuming its present form.
The Lucian Blaga National Theatre in Cluj-Napoca, Romania is one of the most prestigious theatrical institutions in Romania. The theatre shares the same building with the Romanian Opera.
Piata Stefan cel Mare, Nr. 24, Cluj-Napoca, Romania
